eng: How many (little) spruce do you see?
How many (little) spruce do you see?
I don’t see any standing spruce.

den: Gini shchashga k’a nch’u dghileyi łu ghu.

eng: That woman is drinking spring water.

den: Ten ghin k’i qundelcheni łu ghu.

eng: The ice has not broken up.
den: Ten ghin k’i nch’u qundelchen duhti.
Ten ghin k’i nu’idzili łu ghu.

eng: It is a really nice outside.
It is a really nice outside.
S/he is walking around by the lake shore.
S/he is walking around by the creek shore.
S/he is walking around on the mountain.
S/he is walking around on the hill.
I am walking around by the lake shore.
I am walking around on the mountain too.
That woman seems to be picking berries.
What is the man going for?
den: Yada q’u quht’ana ghun (k’i) ihu teyushen din?

eng: The man is going for caribou.
den: (Quht’ana ghin k’i q’u) ghenuy ihu teyushen shin’i.

eng: That dog is sitting upon its house.
den: Łik’a ghin k’i beqenq’a hq’eydeq deydu.

eng: That dog is sitting in its house.
That dog is sitting in front of its house.
That dog is sitting behind its house.
That dog is sitting beside its house.
den: Łik’a ghin k’i qenq’a hyiseh q’eyeq’ eydu.

eng: That dog is sitting on it (house).
den: Łik’a ghin k’i q’eyeq’ gu eydu..

eng: That dog is sitting under its house.
den: Łik’a ghin k’i beqenq’a gheyeh eydu.

eng: What kind of plants are there?
den: Yada du ghu dnełyahi gu da qilan?
Chik’a deldeli gu dnełyah gu k’a.

eng: Is your throat dry (are you thirsty?)
Do you want to drink tea?
Give me the tea you poured for me.
Give me the tea you poured for me.
Give me the water in a cup.
Give me the water that you poured for me.
den: Biłni shu danłtl’idi shlaq’a dichit sa’i.
Ch’anigen gga k’a shlaq’a nłghuł (k’a) shi.

eng: I am not cold any more.
Do you speak my language, the Dena’ina language?
Do you speak the Dena’ina language?
Do you understand the Dena’ina Language?
I do not know the Dena’ina Language.
I understand our Native Language a little.
I am walking to the lake.
I am walking to the store (also).
I am walking to my aunt’s (house).
(That guy) is walking to the store.
S/he is (also) walking to the lake.
I saw a small cow moose.
I was looking at a cow moose.
Did you also see any sheep?
den: (Ki du) nuji ghin’an du (yet ki du)?
Dnaghelt’a gheli sht’a nuji ngheł’ani shi.

eng: It is not snowing any more.
It is starting to be winter for us.
I am going to Mt. Susitna.
I am going to Mt. Susitna.
I am going to the hill.
I am going to the hill.
I am going to the creek.
I am going to the lake.
What kind of small animal is this?
This looks like a moose calf.
A baby rabbit is walking around here.
A small bear cub is walking around here.
A black bear cub is walking around here.
I also have my hats too.
I also have my pants too.
I also have my shirts too.
What kind of tracks are these?.
A mouse went around here and came back.
There is a mouse’s foot pattern.
There are black bear tracks out there.
What kind of tracks are these?
den: Yada du gu ghu gu k’q’e qilani shi?

eng: What kind of tracks are these?
den: Yada di gu ghu k’q’e qilani shi?

eng: What kind of tracks are these?
den: Yada du gu ghu gu k’q’e qilani shi?
K’enuy’a k’a gu ghu q’e qilan.

eng: There are mouse tracks here too.
This is a fish, a salmon.
A fly is flying around here.
A spider is walking around here.
An ant is walking around here.
A butterfly is walking around here.
The fly is flying around here.
The spider is making a web.
Do you speak the Dena’ina language?
I don’t understand the Dena’ina language.
A white one (hat) is also there.
A white one (hat) is also there.

den: Nen k’a nen ts’iłt’an k’a yisan sa’i.

eng: An owl is flying around here.
An owl is flying around here.
The duck is flying around here.
The grouse is making a nest.
What kind of hide did he make (tan)?
den: Ginihti yada q’u łchin dit k’eyes?

eng: This is a caribou hide (that he tanned)
den: Gini k’i ghenuy yes (łchin) łu ghu.
Quht’ana ghin ki yada t’eł’anen din?
K’isen ghun ki yada t’eł’anen din?
K’isen ghun ki yada t’eł’anen din?
